meanings.definition: The belief in or advocacy of a monetary system based on a single metal, typically gold or silver.
meanings.sent1: Some economists argue that monometallisms can lead to economic stability.
meanings.sent2: During the gold standard era, monometallisms were prevalent in many countries.
meanings.sent3: At the conference, the speaker humorously debated the merits of monometallisms.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, monometallisms stand as a beacon of tradition.
meanings.sent5: The history books vividly depict the rise and fall of monometallisms.

meanings.definition: The practice of using only one metal as a standard for currency.
meanings.sent1: Monometallisms were common in ancient civilizations like Rome.
meanings.sent2: The country's economy thrived under the system of monometallisms.
meanings.sent3: The shopkeeper jokingly displayed a sign promoting monometallisms.
meanings.sent4: In the market, monometallisms shone brightly among the various currencies.
meanings.sent5: The concept of monometallisms is simple yet impactful in monetary policy.
